name: lubricity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very smooth and making it easier for one object to slide along the surface of another or to move through a liquid or gas: You need to be sure of the oil's lubricity or your fuel pump might wear excessively. It was a ski slope of unusual lubricity.
More examplesFewer examples Fuel pump failures can easily happen if a driver uses diesel with inadequate lubricity.Some systems heat the fuel, which overcomes its lack of lubricity.Mining equipment must retain good lubricity, so that the surfaces can slide against the rock with little friction.
